isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - TWO SPEED AXLE WIRING

svcproc.title: TWO SPEED AXLE WIRING
svcproc.para: With ignition key ON, power flows from B1 battery stud through circuit 14K, 14R, fuse F2-C, circuit 14S ignition relay (462-R1), and circuit 13P to ignition adapter I2 (495). Then power flows through circuit 93, two speed axle switch (417), circuit 93A, and 93B to the speedometer/tachometer module. When the axle is shifted into high range, air is supplied to the axle shift circuit opening the two speed axle switch and changing the voltage signal to 0 at the speedometer/ tachometer module. Thus speed and mileage are calculated for the different axle ratio.
